content.description: A delightful start and a puzzling finish for the grade. Climb the crack up the corner which goes at maybe 5.6 until you reach the top. The exit is perhaps 5.7. step up the slab to the last 2 bolts. Tricky face moves lead to better holds and a two bolt anchor. This route shares an anchor with the wide crack on the right so maybe you want to run a top rope lap on that.
content.location: From The Block walk to the right scramble over a small boulder and look for a corner with an inviting looking crack splitting it.

content.description: Though it looks like an off-width crack it climbs a bit more like a sport route for the most part. Stick Clip the first bolt. Layback the crack by it's right wall until you can transfer hands to the left wall. Use a little chimney style to inch your way up past 2 more bolts to the ledge. Walk the ledge to the upper wall and dance your way to the anchors. You can climb the 5.7 to the left to set this up on TR if you aren't feeling the lead.
content.location: From The Block walk right and scramble over a small boulder. Look for the obvious wide crack/tight chimney.

content.description: The start is the crux. Thin moves up the corner to get your hands on a beefy ledge. Place a thin cam (.3 BD works well). Continue up the corner to its top. move left into an under-cling (there is a bolt just over the lip. Clip it). Make thin but solid moves up onto the slab (best part of the climb) and do a quick jog to the anchor.
content.protection: trad gear 1 bolts to ring anchors.
content.location: Walk behind The Block on it's right hand side. As you enter the "the back room" you will be facing a 90 degree corner. That is the route.

content.description: A little route up the right arete just before you get to the alcove. Climb crux moves off the ground heading over toward the arete. Get some easier climbing on the arete and then head back left onto the slab finish.
content.protection: 4 bolts to anchor, currently draws on the anchor for lowering off.
content.location: From the block walk right and look for the last line of bolts before you would have to scramble over the little boulder in the trail.

content.description: To the right of The Block there are a few more routes both sport and trad.
